intro: Callitriche platycarpa, commonly known as broad-fruited water starwort, is a small aquatic plant belonging to the family Hydrocharitaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, floating leaves that are typically oval or elliptical in shape. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in still or slow-moving freshwater environments, such as ponds and lakes. Its reproductive strategy involves both sexual reproduction through seeds and vegetative propagation via runners.
